item.title: 8 potholes, 2 of which MAJOR (wide and deep) on A406 in the lane that heads SW/ towards Hendon (see box below for more info), 25th February
item.description:
On the North Circular there are multiple drains in the right hand lane which runs South West (away from Finchley and towards Hendon). 8 of the drains in the right hand lane (the lane which is against the central reservation) have potholes around the drains where tarmac and lower rubble etc has come away. Two of these potholes are HUGE, wide and VERY deep, the others also deep and needing repair but less wide/ deep. The two worst of these need urgent filling in the next 24 hours as people are going to blow their tyres here. The positioning of the potholes around each of the 8 drains means that everyone's right hand tyres are going through them, the widest ones being impossible to safely avoid (as you can't move left because of the lane of traffic to the left of you). The potholes are predominantly in the section between Clandon Gardens and Edge Hill Avenue, the worst ones between Clandon Gardens and Beechwood Avenue, opposite to the green hoarding and then the flats, but on the OTHER side of the road i.e. heading SW.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Circular Road, Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
